definitions: To enter a place or area in large numbers, especially with military force, in order to take control.
To enter a place or situation in an unwelcome or intrusive way.
To spread into or affect injuriously a body part or system, as with a disease or tumor.
examples: The army plans to invade the neighboring country.
Tourists often invade the quiet town during summer.
The cancer cells began to invade surrounding tissues.
